publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-5959♦ Jackie Baillie: Pushed off the EDGE—That the Parliament expresses its concern that the Encouraging Dynamic Global Entrepreneurs (EDGE) programme has been cancelled; understands that EDGE is an innovative, international entrepreneurial programme that brings together students from leading Scottish universities, fifth-year school pupils in the Dumbarton constituency and in the rest of Scotland and students from international universities; further understands that the students form consultancy teams working on projects with Scottish businesses; considers that, in the four years that EDGE has been operating, it has equipped Scotland’s pupils and students with an understanding about business needs; notes that EDGE has also helped businesses to grow and develop, with projected outcomes of £24.6 million turnover, £3 million profits and 264 jobs created; further considers that the benefit to young Scottish students at both high school and university level is invaluable, and would welcome discussion by all those involved to secure the future of the programme.
S3M-5959♦ Pushed off the EDGE (lodged on 15 March 2010) Hugh Henry*
S3M-5959♦ Pushed off the EDGE (lodged on 15 March 2010) Ken Macintosh*, Jack McConnell*, Elaine Murray*

S3M-5959♦ Jackie Baillie: Pushed off the EDGE—That the Parliament expresses its concern that the Encouraging Dynamic Global Entrepreneurs (EDGE) programme has been cancelled; understands that EDGE is an innovative, international entrepreneurial programme that brings together students from leading Scottish universities, fifth-year school pupils in the Dumbarton constituency and in the rest of Scotland and students from international universities; further understands that the students form consultancy teams working on projects with Scottish businesses; considers that, in the four years that EDGE has been operating, it has equipped Scotland’s pupils and students with an understanding about business needs; notes that EDGE has also helped businesses to grow and develop, with projected outcomes of £24.6 million turnover, £3 million profits and 264 jobs created; further considers that the benefit to young Scottish students at both high school and university level is invaluable, and would welcome discussion by all those involved to secure the future of the programme. Supported by: Des McNulty, James Kelly, Trish Godman, Sarah Boyack, Hugh Henry, Ken Macintosh, Jack McConnell, Elaine Murray, Cathy Peattie*
S3M-5959♦ Pushed off the EDGE (lodged on 15 March 2010) Johann Lamont*
S3M-5959♦ Pushed off the EDGE (lodged on 15 March 2010) Marilyn Livingstone*
S3M-5959♦ Pushed off the EDGE (lodged on 15 March 2010) Mary Mulligan*
S3M-5959♦ Pushed off the EDGE (lodged on 15 March 2010) David Stewart*
S3M-5959 Pushed off the EDGE (lodged on 15 March 2010) Ms Wendy Alexander*, Patricia Ferguson*, Andy Kerr*, John Park*, Karen Gillon*, Hugh O’Donnell*, Dr Richard Simpson*

S3M-5959#Jackie Baillie:Pushed off the EDGE—That the Parliament expresses its concern that the Encouraging Dynamic Global Entrepreneurs (EDGE) programme has been cancelled; understands that EDGE is an innovative, international entrepreneurial programme that brings together students from leading Scottish universities, fifth-year school pupils in the Dumbarton constituency and in the rest of Scotland and students from international universities; further understands that the students form consultancy teams working on projects with Scottish businesses; considers that, in the four years that EDGE has been operating, it has equipped Scotland’s pupils and students with an understanding about business needs; notes that EDGE has also helped businesses to grow and develop, with projected outcomes of £24.6 million turnover, £3 million profits and 264 jobs created; further considers that the benefit to young Scottish students at both high school and university level is invaluable, and would welcome discussion by all those involved to secure the future of the programme. Supported by: Des McNulty, James Kelly, Trish Godman, Sarah Boyack, Hugh Henry, Ken Macintosh, Jack McConnell, Elaine Murray, Cathy Peattie, Johann Lamont, Marilyn Livingstone, Mary Mulligan, David Stewart, Ms Wendy Alexander, Patricia Ferguson, Andy Kerr, John Park, Karen Gillon, Hugh O’Donnell, Dr Richard Simpson
S3M-5959# Pushed off the EDGE (lodged on 15 March 2010) Claire Baker* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
S3M-5959# Pushed off the EDGE (lodged on 15 March 2010) Cathy Jamieson* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
